"Otherwise, we will become a digital colony which is dependent on other countries for this core, core technology," he noted.

articles.title: Microsoft President Smith visits Delhi govt school, launches plan to skill 20 lakh teachers in AI
articles.summary: Microsoft has launched a major initiative in India to train teachers in Artificial Intelligence. The program aims to skill twenty lakh teachers and reach two lakh schools by the year 2030. This effort will integrate AI literacy and computational thinking into the curriculum. India is the first Asian country to receive this program.

articles.title: UK to make tech firms remove abusive images within 48 hours of alert
articles.summary: Victims of abusive images would have to report them only once for tech companies to remove them from multiple online platforms under the new measures, which could come into force as early as this summer. Failure to act would result in firms facing a fine of up to 10% of their global revenue or having their services blocked in the UK, the government said in a statement.

articles.title: India updates trade index base year to FY23 to better capture new-age trade trends
articles.summary: India has updated its merchandise trade indices. The new base year is FY 2022-23, replacing the old FY 2012-13. This change better reflects current trade realities and global commerce patterns. The Directorate General of Commercial Intelligence and Statistics announced the revision. It follows expert committee recommendations for international statistical alignment. This will aid policymakers and businesses.

articles.title: India operationalises 10 out of 11 sub-schemes of Export Promotion Mission
articles.summary: Piyush Goyal launched seven initiatives to empower MSMEs, boost exports, address finance, compliance, logistics, and strengthen India’s global trade.

articles.title: TCS, OpenAI form AI tie-up that spans Agentic AI to data centres in India
articles.summary: TCS will build out its OpenAI offerings globally, while constructing an up to 1 GW data centre in India.

articles.title: Accenture US makes AI tool adoption key to leadership promotions
articles.summary: Accenture US now requires senior staff to use AI tools for leadership promotion, reflecting its AI adoption push and partnerships with OpenAI and Anthropic.

articles.title: Lucid trims 12% of workforce as it seeks profitability: Report
articles.summary: Lucid is ​laying off 12% ‌of its ⁠workforce ⁠to "improve ​operational effectiveness ​and optimize our ​resources ⁠as ‌we ​continue ​on ⁠our path toward ​profitability," TechCrunch reported ​on Friday, ‌citing an ​internal ​memo.

articles.title: India can double its share in global media with AI adoption, JioStar vice chairman Uday Shankar
articles.summary: The global media market is valued at nearly USD 3 trillion, and is projected to reach USD 3.5 trillion by 2029, said Uday Shankar in his keynote address at the ongoing AI Impact Summit 2026.

articles.title: Qualcomm and Tata Electronics partner to manufacture Qualcomm Automotive Modules in India
articles.summary: Qualcomm Technologies and Tata Electronics have partnered to produce Qualcomm Automotive Modules in India at Tata’s new OSAT facility in Jagiroad, Assam. The collaboration joins Tata Electronics to Qualcomm’s global module manufacturing network. It aims to support local production for digital cockpits, infotainment, connectivity, and intelligent vehicle systems.

articles.title: Meta cuts stock awards by 5% for most employees, FT reports
articles.summary: Meta reduced its annual distribution of stock ​options by about ​5% for most of its staff, as CEO ​Mark Zuckerberg ploughs billions of dollars into its artificial intelligence goals, the Financial Times reported on Thursday.

articles.title: Dell aggressively hiking local content in India-made servers: India President Manish Gupta
articles.summary: Dell Technologies India is aggressively increasing the indigenised content in it's made-in-India servers, and aiming for up to 50% domestic content for its notebooks, specifically the Dell Pro 14 and Pro 14 Plus models, under the production-Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme 2.0 for IT hardware, Manish Gupta, president and MD of Dell Technologies India, told ET in an interview.

articles.title: India must move from tech services-led nation to IP-led nation: HCLTech's Roshni Nadar
articles.summary: India's technology sector needs a significant shift. Roshni Nadar Malhotra, HCL Technologies chairperson, advocates for moving from scale-driven growth to an AI-focused, IP-driven model. The future belongs to those who build and own platforms, not just deploy technology. This transformation requires strategic shifts towards IP creation, building capabilities, and establishing a national AI infrastructure.

articles.title: UN hopes AI tech can aid the starving as funding collapses
articles.summary: As tech leaders hail dizzying change and billion-dollar deals at a global artificial intelligence summit in India, their promises collide with a stark reality -- record hunger and shrinking donor support.

articles.title: Exciting to see this much interest: Tech giant Vinod Khosla on India AI Impact Summit
articles.summary: Tech Giant and founder of Sun Microsystems, Vinod Khosla, on Thursday, expressed his optimism about India's growing interest and role in AI, as the country hosts the first international AI summit in the global south.

articles.title: Healthcare, education, deep research, all areas will flourish with AI: Bharti Chairman Sunil Mittal
articles.summary: Mittal, speaking at the India AI Impact Summit, said that AI is becoming an integral part of the company's operations

articles.title: Technologies pioneered in India set standard for Global South: Dario Amodei
articles.summary: Speaking on Anthropic’s latest moves in India during his address at the India AI Impact Summit, Amodei said the company’s expansion reflected its long-term commitment to the market. “As a sign of our commitment, we just this week opened an office in Bengaluru and hired Irina Ghose, who has spent three decades building businesses in India, as our managing director for Anthropic India,” he said.

articles.title: Outcome of AI neither guaranteed, nor automatic: Google CEO Sundar Pichai
articles.summary: Highlighting AI’s transformative potential, Pichai said during his keynote address at the India AI Impact Summit how deep scientific breakthroughs are being accelerated by advances in machine learning.

articles.title: Factory activity at three-mth high in February
articles.summary: India's private sector activity accelerated in February. The HSBC Flash Composite Output Index reached a three-month high. Manufacturing output saw sharper expansion, boosting overall growth. New orders and overseas demand supported this upturn. Businesses are optimistic about future activity. Employment growth also touched a three-month high as firms stepped up hiring.

articles.title: India core output slows to 4% in January
articles.summary: India's core sector growth slowed to 4% in January. Energy industries saw moderated momentum. Infrastructure sectors like cement and steel remained strong, reflecting economic investment. Electricity generation eased. Refinery products output was flat. Crude oil and natural gas production contracted. Coal and fertiliser output also saw slower growth. This slowdown is expected to impact overall industrial production.

articles.title: Base year for goods trade indices revised to '22-23
articles.summary: India's merchandise trade indices have a new base year, 2022-23, replacing the old 2012-13. This update reflects significant economic shifts and evolving trade patterns. The revised indices offer a more accurate picture of exports and imports. They are crucial for economic analysis and policy decisions. This revision enhances the relevance and reliability of trade data for all users.

articles.title: China-bound exports in double digits even as US shipments fall and trade deficit widens: RBI
articles.summary: India's merchandise trade deficit widened in January 2026 as imports outpaced exports, driven by a surge in gold and silver shipments. Despite external pressures, the domestic economy showed resilience with sustained momentum in industrial and services sectors, supported by strong domestic demand and improved investor sentiment.

articles.title: India’s core sectors’ growth loses steam, slows to 4% in January
articles.summary: India's core infrastructure sectors expanded by 4.0% in January 2026, a slowdown from December's 4.7% growth. This moderation was primarily driven by strong performance in the steel and cement industries. For the April-January period of 2025-26, cumulative growth reached 2.8%.

articles.title: India calls for deeper cooperation in R&D, biotech, pharma with Switzerland
articles.summary: India is seeking enhanced collaboration with Switzerland in research, biotechnology, and pharmaceuticals. This move aims to bolster economic relations between the two nations. Swiss investments are also being encouraged in areas of Switzerland's technological expertise.

articles.title: India's agri products, auto exports making greater inroads in EU
articles.summary: India's exports to EU: Of India's USD 19.3 billion in global automotive exports during the first nine months of 2025-26, the EU's share rose to 11.6 per cent from 9.8 per cent in April-December 2024, the data showed.

articles.title: India's consumer inflation estimated at 4.3% in FY27, up from 2.5% in FY26: Crisil
articles.summary: Consumer inflation in India is set to climb to 4.3 percent in fiscal 2027. This rise follows an estimated 2.5 percent in fiscal 2026. Food inflation will normalize from current low levels. Changes in the Consumer Price Index basket will limit the overall increase. Non-food inflation and core inflation are expected to help restrain the rise.

articles.title: Brent rises late, settles higher and with weekly gain on Iran-US jitters
articles.summary: Brent crude prices saw a late-day surge due to short-covering as investors reacted to escalating U.S.-Iran tensions over nuclear weapon development. Despite this, both Brent and WTI futures experienced weekly gains, with traders betting on higher prices amidst concerns over potential supply disruptions in the Strait of Hormuz.

articles.title: UPL to spin off crop protection arm into a separate listed entity
articles.summary: UPL approved a group reorganisation to separate its India and global crop protection businesses into a newly listed UPL Global Sustainable Agri Solutions. The move aims to unlock value, streamline operations, enhance capital flexibility, and create a focused pure-play crop protection platform.

articles.title: Indian 10-year bond yield surges most in two weeks on US–Iran jitters
articles.summary: India's benchmark 10-year government ​bond yield spiked on Friday, ​driven by mounting concerns about a potential military confrontation ​between the U.S. and Iran that has bid crude oil prices up to their highest in six months.

articles.title: Gainers & Losers: Novartis India and GMDC among 6 stocks in focus on Friday. Here’s why
articles.summary: Novartis India and GMDC led market action on Friday as broader indices recovered, while select stocks saw sharp gains and profit booking.

articles.title: Milky Mist on track for 2026 IPO despite market jitters, CEO says
articles.summary: Indian dairy products maker Milky Mist will push ​ahead with its planned ​initial public offering this year despite volatile markets, its ​CEO said, adding the company expects to maintain about 30% annual revenue growth.

articles.title: Rupee posts steepest weekly drop in a month, nears 91 per dollar
articles.summary: The Indian rupee experienced its steepest weekly fall in a month, nearing the 91-per-dollar mark due to portfolio outflows and geopolitical tensions. Central bank intervention helped stabilize the currency, while a strong dollar index, driven by U.S. economic data and Middle East tensions, also played a role.

articles.title: Shapoorji Pallonji Real Estate to develop a residential project on Pokhran Road 2, Thane
articles.summary: Shapoorji Pallonji Real Estate (SPRE), one of India's most trusted real estate developers, has announced the launch of Oyster, a premium residential project within its expansive 4.8-acre development, Northern Lights, located on the prime Pokhran Road 2 in Thane.

articles.title: Nestle, Britannia among 4 high-conviction FMCG and retail picks from Axis Direct, here’s why
articles.summary: Axis Direct has recommended four high-conviction FMCG and retail stocks post Q3 earnings, including Nestle India, Britannia, DOMS Industries and V-Mart Retail. The brokerage sees up to 32% upside, driven by strong demand recovery, expansion strategies, improving margins and favourable macro factors such as GST reforms and rural consumption trends.

articles.title: Gaurav Jogani sees jewellery, footwear driving consumer discretionary growth
articles.summary: Jewellery and footwear sectors are driving growth in consumer discretionary spending. Quick-service restaurants are adapting with pricing strategies. Margins are improving due to cost management. Experts see limited downside in valuations. Key metrics to watch include same-store sales growth and brand margins. Titan, Lenskart, Metro Brands, Vishal Mega Mart, Devyani, and Sapphire are top picks.

articles.title: Indian IT companies returned Rs 4.8 lakh crore cash to shareholders, spent little on R&D. Will the AI cost prove existential?
articles.summary: Indian IT stocks face a sharp correction amid concerns over AI disruption and low R D investment. Aequitas highlights heavy shareholder payouts over reinvestment, raising long-term competitiveness questions. While risks to revenue and margins persist, experts remain divided on whether AI poses an existential threat or a transformative opportunity for the sector.

articles.title: 10 stocks slip up to 30% in a month. Rebound potential ahead?
articles.summary: Indian equities experienced significant volatility last month, with many BSE500 stocks seeing sharp declines. However, analyst forecasts suggest potential rebounds for several of these battered stocks, with some projected to offer substantial upside in the coming period.

articles.title: Markets in a seesaw phase; investors should use volatility to back largecap stocks: Rahul Shah
articles.summary: Equity markets experienced a sharp reversal this week, erasing early gains and sparking debate about deeper weakness. Despite the choppiness, market experts remain constructive, citing strong earnings trends and sectoral tailwinds. Rahul Shah highlights robust profit growth and positive outlooks for BFSI, metals, consumption, autos, and cement, recommending selective investment in largecap stocks.

articles.title: Tech leaders are all in on AI; the public, not so much
articles.summary: Silicon Valley touts AI as revolutionary, but public skepticism is high. Surveys show limited workplace impact, widespread fear, and strong support for regulation.

articles.title: Mistral sees AI as utility, emphasis more on efficiency: Founder Arthur Mensch
articles.summary: Indian entrepreneurs must run cos from own country to ensure innovation stays here, says founder Mensch.

articles.title: ‘Frugal’ Sarvam AI did a DeepSeek with just 40 researchers
articles.summary: Sarvam is already deploying its models in enterprise and government use cases, including voice AI and language technologies. Cofounder Pratyush Kumar said the company trained multiple models internally, without relying on any external technology stack.

articles.title: Indian IT captains hold firm amid raging agentic AI storm
articles.summary: K Krithivasan, chief executive officer and managing director of Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), said while it’s not clear exactly what the roles will be a few years down the line due to disruption owing to AI, he does not envisage a “significant shrinkage” to TCS and the industry at large.

articles.title: US leads AI brain race followed by China, Singapore; India at 6th spot: Report
articles.summary: The study, published by essayhumaniser.io, evaluates over 100 countries using a weighted framework combining artificial intelligence (AI) R D, economic integration, infrastructure, talent readiness, governance, responsible AI, public opinion and academic strength.

articles.title: Peak XV’s $1.3 billion fund; General Catalyst’s $5 billion India bet
articles.summary: Peak XV Partners has raised its first independent fund since its split from Sequoia Capital. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Critical thinking, not reliance on AI, will protect against de-skilling: Elsevier's Jan Herzhoff
articles.summary: Herzhoff, who was attending the India AI Impact Summit 2026 from February 16-20, reflected on a 2025 study in The Lancet Gastroenterology and Hepatology journal and said that de-skilling happens when clinicians don't apply critical thinking and rely on "that little answer chunk" before moving to the next patient.

articles.title: Prof.ai to founder.ai
articles.summary: When Covid-19 struck in 2020, Sashikumaar Ganeshan at the Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore built a model to predict the spread of the contagion, marking his deep immersion into AI technologies. He later founded ZenteiQ.ai to develop scientific foundational model Brahm AI. Similar patterns are seen among researchers launching AI startups.

articles.title: Amazon's cloud unit hit was hit by least two outages involving AI tools in December: FT
articles.summary: The service interruption was an "extremely limited event" when a single ‌service in one of the two regions in mainland China was affected, ​the spokesperson ​said, adding ⁠that it did not impact compute, storage, database, AI technologies, or any other of AWS's services.

articles.title: AI ushers in hyper progress, can help emerging economies leapfrog: Google CEO Pichai
articles.summary: Pichai said Google is establishing a full-stack AI hub in Visakhapatnam in Andhra Pradesh as part of its previously announced USD 15 billion infrastructure investment in India. The facility will house gigawatt-scale compute capacity and a new international subsea cable gateway, aimed at expanding jobs and AI access across the country.

articles.title: Current AI technology is limited, just good at language: AMI Labs executive chairman Yann LeCun
articles.summary: Silicon Valley is entirely focused on LLMs, stealing each other’s engineers and pursuing similar approaches. This leaves the industry short-sighted, said the tech leader. LeCun also argued that human-level intelligence cannot be achieved by training AI systems solely on human-produced text. Instead, he said, future systems will need to learn from sensory inputs and develop a deeper understanding of how the real world works.

articles.title: Reliance puts $110 billion on table, joins Adani & Tata in big-ticket AI buildout
articles.summary: India Inc is making massive AI moves, with Reliance Industries pledging $110 billion over seven years to build AI-focused infrastructure. Tata Group is partnering with OpenAI to scale AI-ready data centres. Adani Enterprises also plans a $100 billion investment by 2035, signalling a major national push into AI.

articles.title: Balancing AI and copyright; Adani's $100B bet
articles.summary: Day 2 of the India AI Impact Summit featured additional announcements, sessions, and policy discussions focused on emerging technology. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Passenger vehicle sales keep the momentum in Jan, rise in double digits for a 4th month
articles.summary: Indian auto sales are off to a strong start in the new year. Passenger vehicle sales saw double-digit growth for the fourth month running in January. Two- and three-wheeler segments also posted significant gains. This positive trend indicates sustained demand and supports economic activity across the country. The automotive sector is poised for continued growth.

articles.title: Earnings set for strong rebound in FY27 after weak FY26, says Mahesh Nandurkar
articles.summary: Indian investors are learning the importance of diversifying beyond domestic equities. Mahesh Nandurkar of Jefferies highlights the need for global exposure. He also notes the Union Budget has become less of a market mover. Corporate earnings are expected to significantly improve next year, driven by factors like inflation and stabilizing interest rates. Nandurkar is optimistic about future market growth.

articles.title: AI job fears trigger IT selloff; Unmesh Sharma sees opportunity for Indian IT, not doom
articles.summary: Indian technology stocks experienced a sharp decline following AI breakthroughs. However, an expert highlights that India's strength lies in AI implementation rather than core innovation. Electronics manufacturing services are identified as a multi-year growth sector. Investors are advised to navigate volatility with a focus on structural themes and disciplined positioning for future gains.

articles.title: Ex-Sequoia Capital India arm raises $1.3 billion after key exits
articles.summary: Peak XV Partners raised 1.3 billion dollars for AI and consumer startups in India and South East Asia, led by Shailendra Singh, after splitting from Sequoia Capital in 2023.

articles.title: AI won’t kill India’s services economy, it will upgrade it: Vijay Shekhar Sharma
articles.summary: Vijay Shekhar Sharma believes AI will expand India’s services economy, transforming BPOs into global healthcare providers and reshaping finance with AI-powered advisory and underwriting.

articles.title: Tomato, onion and potato price shocks drive bulk of inflation volatility: RBI study
articles.summary: Vegetable price spikes, especially in tomato, onion and potato, account for over 80% of recent headline inflation volatility, according to a Reserve Bank of India study.

articles.title: India revises base year of merchandise trade indices to FY23 to reflect changing trade patterns
articles.summary: DGCI S has updated India’s Merchandise Trade Indices base year to 2022-23, reflecting current trade patterns. Prof. Nachiketa Chattopadhyay chaired the revision committee.

articles.title: UP court sentences ex-junior engineer, wife to death for sexual exploitation of 33 children
articles.summary: The couple was convicted under provisions of the Indian Penal Code and the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act by the court of Additional District and Sessions Judge (POCSO) Pradeep Kumar Mishra.

articles.title: India’s FTAs now unlock 70% of global GDP, says Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: Piyush Goyal highlights India’s nine FTAs, including with the United States, boosting export access to 70 percent of global GDP. Bharat Mart in Dubai and AI Summit investments drive growth.

articles.title: India’s core sector growth slips to 4% in January; momentum eases from December high
articles.summary: India’s core sector growth slowed to 4% in January 2026, with steel and cement expanding strongly while coal, crude oil, and natural gas production weakened, signaling broad-based moderation.

articles.title: Indian IT stocks not yet bargain buys, says Bandhan AMC's Manish Gunwani
articles.summary: Manish Gunwani, Head – Equity at Bandhan AMC prefers manufacturing and export-oriented sectors over consumption, and believes investors can expect 6–7% real returns when markets trade at fair value.

articles.title: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei: AI could transform India’s economy, but disruption must be managed
articles.summary: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei said AI has the potential to lift millions out of poverty and significantly expand India’s economic growth. However, he cautioned that the technology could also cause disruption, calling for close coordination with governments to manage its impact.

articles.title: Nirmala Sitharaman meets Norwegian CEOs to discuss India investment scope
articles.summary: Speaking at the session with 35 Norwegian CEOs and investors in Oslo, FM Nirmala Sitharaman said, 'My official visit to Norway has witnessed engaging and positive discussions on India as an investment destination and the fastest growing major economy of the world.'

articles.title: AI is a 'civilisational change': N Chandrasekaran sees big opportunity for India’s IT
articles.summary: Calling AI a civilisation-scale shift, N Chandrasekaran says enterprise adoption will unlock latent demand, positioning India’s IT services firms for large-scale transformation opportunities.

articles.title: Food Secretary: India's sugar supply "comfortably" placed despite production estimates down by 13 LT
articles.summary: India's sugar production is estimated at 330 LT, with consumption at 290 LT, ensuring surplus. AISTA reports 2.01 LT exports in 2025-26, mainly to UAE, Afghanistan, Djibouti, and Bhutan.

articles.title: Gokaldas Exports expects 12-15% revenue growth in FY27 as US sourcing returns
articles.summary: Gokaldas Exports is expanding in Europe and continuing diversification. It also plans capex of around ₹175 crore over two years and is open to expansion through acquisitions. Management said trade deals and tariff normalisation could support textile exports and jobs growth.

articles.title: Why India’s cash in circulation hit ₹40 lakh crore despite record UPI surge? Check here
articles.summary: India’s currency in circulation hits ₹40 lakh crore, while UPI transactions reach ₹28.3 lakh crore monthly. SBI Research notes digital payments are driving incremental GDP growth amid rising cash.

articles.title: India’s unemployment rate rises to 5% in January 2026
articles.summary: India’s unemployment rate rose to 5% in January 2026, with overall labour force participation rate (LFPR) at 55.9% and worker population ratio (WPR) at 53.1%. Urban and rural workforce participation remained largely stable as did female LFPR, month-on-month.

articles.title: India's trade deficit soars to record high as gold imports surge
articles.summary: For the April–January period, merchandise exports rose 2.22% to $366.63 billion, while imports climbed 7.21% to $649.86 billion, keeping the deficit elevated.

articles.title: Bill Gates meets Andhra CM Naidu in Amaravati ahead of AI Impact Summit; discusses health, agri, and tech
articles.summary: Bill Gates visited Amaravati, met Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu to discuss health, agriculture, and tech collaboration ahead of the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi.

articles.title: India’s wholesale inflation rises to 10-month high in January
articles.summary: India's wholesale inflation rose to 1.81% in January from 0.83%, mainly due to higher food prices and increased manufacturing sector costs. Certain kitchen items remain significantly cheaper than a year ago.

articles.title: Qualcomm to make automotive modules in India at Tata’s $3 billion Assam plant
articles.summary: Qualcomm Technologies has partnered with Tata Electronics to manufacture automotive modules in India at its upcoming OSAT facility in Assam, aiming to meet demand from Indian and global automakers.

articles.title: Statiq raises $18 million, eyes UAE expansion and more highway EV chargers
articles.summary: EV charging firm Statiq has secured about $18 million in equity and debt led by Tenacity Ventures to expand its network across India, add highway fast chargers, and begin overseas expansion.

articles.title: Oil surges to six-month high on US-Iran conflict worries
articles.summary: Oil prices hit six-month highs as Brent settled at $71.66 and WTI at $66.43, driven by US Iran tensions, Strait of Hormuz drills, Saudi export drop, and strong US crude demand.

articles.title: Nykaa to bring viral Korean skincare brand medicube to India
articles.summary: Nykaa has teamed up with South Korea’s APR Corporation to bring viral skincare brand medicube to India, expanding its Korean beauty portfolio across online and offline channels.

articles.title: KEI sees ₹25,000 crore opportunity for cable industry on data centre push
articles.summary: KEI Industries CMD Anil Gupta expects 20% annual growth and said imports are not a concern, with domestic players well equipped to supply large projects.

articles.title: A weak summer could spell disaster for AC industry: Blue Star MD
articles.summary: Blue Star MD B Thiagarajan sees strong growth in data centre projects, with an order book of ₹1,500 crore and a market opportunity of ₹3,000–4,000 crore. Price hikes of up to 10% have been implemented, depending on the product.

articles.title: TCS gets into AI-collaboration race, partners with Sam Altman's OpenAI
articles.summary: TCS partners with OpenAI for AI-powered innovation across Tata Group, focusing on Agentic AI solutions and infrastructure. Sam Altman and N Chandrasekaran highlight India's AI leadership.

articles.title: Bharti Airtel launches AI & Cyber Threat Research Centre in India with Zscaler
articles.summary: The centre is aimed at protecting sectors considered critical to India’s economic and national security, including telecommunications, banking and energy, as well as digital users.

articles.title: India now drives global edible oil trade; exporters track its demand: SD Guthrie’s Sandeep Bhan
articles.summary: SD Guthrie International’s Sandeep Bhan says India has become the key global edible oil market, with palm oil imports rising due to price differentials and substitution with soybean oil.

articles.title: UPL announces restructuring, to create two listed entities
articles.summary: UPL will restructure into UPL and UPL Global Sustainable Agri Solutions, merging UPL SAS and demerging India crop protection. Promoters will hold 33.1 percent in UPL, 71.6 percent in UPL Global.

articles.title: RPP Infra jumps 7% after ₹206 crore Chennai Global Sports City order
articles.summary: The project is scheduled to be completed within 18 months from the date of handing over the site.

articles.title: US-Iran tensions, oil risk, and IT growth concerns cloud market outlook, says Arvind Sanger
articles.summary: Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management, warns that rising Iran-US tensions and higher oil prices could put pressure on Indian markets, even as the IT sector grapples with slowing growth and uncertainty around AI-led disruption.

articles.title: AI disruption fear might strike auto insurers next. Two stocks are in the crosshairs
articles.summary: BMO warns self-driving cars may hurt Progressive and Allstate, but Fidelis, Hamilton, Kinsale, and RenaissanceRe have no exposure to this risk.

articles.title: Why Inox Wind’s upbeat guidance is not exciting the market
articles.summary: Inox Wind’s guidance points to strong revenue and margin growth, but investors are watching execution more closely. With ₹3,200 crore delivered so far, the company needs a sharp fourth-quarter ramp-up to meet its ₹5,000 crore target

articles.title: UTI AMC’s Sharwan Goyal sees quant strategies reshaping India’s equity markets
articles.summary: Sharwan Goyal of UTI AMC says quant strategies are transforming India’s equity markets with data-driven, adaptive multi-factor investing.

articles.title: Rupee falls 27 paise amid dollar strength and rising oil
articles.summary: The Indian rupee fell to 90.94 against the US dollar, breaching 91 in thin holiday trade outside Mumbai. Dollar demand, oil price rise, and US Iran tensions amplified the decline.

articles.title: Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam gets 'battery torch' symbol
articles.summary: The Election Commission of India allotted the Battery Torch symbol to Makkal Needhi Maiam for the 2026 Puducherry polls. Kamal Haasan leads MNM, which campaigned for the DMK-led INDIA bloc.

articles.title: Nearly one-fourth of BMC winners face criminal cases, majority are crorepatis, says ADR report
articles.summary: According to the ADR report, party-wise data shows that 33% of winners from the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) have declared criminal cases. This is followed by 24% from Shiv Sena and 15% from Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray).

articles.title: Chandra Grahan on Holi 2026? Check time and visibility of total lunar eclipse on March 3 in India
articles.summary: A rare total lunar eclipse will align with Holi on March 3, visible across India, prompting changes to colour celebrations due to the morning sutak period.

articles.title: Who is Ranvir Sachdeva? 8-year-old coder and youngest speaker at India AI Summit 2026
articles.summary: Eight-year-old technologist Ranvir Sachdeva became the youngest speaker at the India AI Impact Summit 2026 in New Delhi, presenting ideas on linking ancient Indian philosophy with modern AI systems.

articles.title: High-rise near INS Shikra: HC raps Navy over ‘lapse’, 'intelligence failure'
articles.summary: Bombay High Court criticized the Navy for intelligence failure over an unnoticed high-rise near INS Shikra, questioned selective opposition, and warned of possible demolition if NOC was mandatory.

articles.title: Hyderabad coaching institute fire: Students, staff evacuated amid fears many were trapped
articles.summary: A fire at a Hyderabad coaching institute in Nilgiri Block, Maitrivanam complex, Ameerpet trapped 90 students. All were safely evacuated. PTI suspects an electric short circuit caused the blaze.

articles.title: US Ambassador Sergio Gor backs India’s Pax Silica entry, says ‘we choose to win’
articles.summary: US Ambassador Sergio Gor called India's entry into the Pax Silica alliance as historic win and hailed India's efforts into the semiconductor and tech industry while also calling Pax Silica as the coalition that will "define" economic and technological order of the 21st century.

articles.title: Paparo visit signals steady reset in India-US military cooperation
articles.summary: Adm. Samuel J. Paparo’s visit to India highlights deepening US-India defence ties, focusing on the Quad, interoperability, and the 2025 Framework, amid ongoing high-level military engagements.

articles.title: India joins 'Pax Silica' — here's what the US-led alliance aims to do
articles.summary: India will formally join the US-led Pax Silica on February 20, deepening economic and technology ties. Pax Silica focuses on critical minerals, semiconductors, and AI infrastructure.

articles.title: Gaganyaan Drogue Parachute clears qualification load test at DRDO’s RTRS facility
articles.summary: The test proves India’s expertise in designing and manufacturing of high strength ribbon parachutes, says Ministry of Defence

articles.title: Arundhati Bhattacharya sees faster AI adoption in India as enterprises await clear returns
articles.summary: The Salesforce CEO said that concerns around job losses in frontline sales and service roles may be overstated, as these positions are more likely to evolve than disappear.

articles.title: India has leapfrogged other countries in AI adoption, says Adobe’s Shantanu Narayen
articles.summary: Shantanu Narayen, CEO of Adobe, said the company has integrated AI across its entire product portfolio and has also introduced AI-first offerings such as Firefly and Express.

articles.title: AI 'answer engines' could upend internet's ad-driven business model: Cloudflare
articles.summary: Matthew Prince, CEO of Cloudflare, Inc., said India represents a significant growth opportunity as the country accelerates efforts to build sovereign AI infrastructure.

articles.title: India AI Impact Summit 2026: Tech Mahindra launches education-focused Hindi AI model
articles.summary: The model was developed using NVIDIA's advanced AI frameworks and infrastructure, including the NVIDIA NeMo framework and deployment via NVIDIA NIM microservices.
